articles.description: Queensland has recorded no new cases of coronavirus in the last 24 hours, but Health Minister Steven Miles says the state’s own modelling predicted a very different outcome.
articles.content:
QUEENSLAND has only 12 remaining active cases of coronavirus, after the state recorded no new cases in the last 24 hours.
Health Minister Steven Miles said there had now been several days with zero reported cases.
Queensland's total remains at 1057.
Mr Mil… [+1780 chars]

articles.title: Mother roundworms have ultra-protective instincts: New study shows animals pass signals to future offspring to warn them of danger - Science Daily
articles.description: Biologists have learned animals can alert future offspring of dangers they will encounter when born. In studies with roundworms and mouse cells, researchers showed how mothers pass chemical signals to their unfertilized eggs, where the warning is stored in th…
articles.content: Talk about motherly instincts: Biologists at the University of Iowa have learned that female roundworms can alert their future offspring of dangers they will encounter when born, and the mothers pass on these warnings even before the offspring have been conce… [+4183 chars]

articles.author: Matthew Rozsa
articles.title: Paging "Dr. Google"? Internet self-diagnosis generally yields bad health advice, study says - Salon
articles.description: Researchers confirm that symptom checkers rarely do a good job of diagnosing what ails you
articles.content: A new study from Australia reveals that medical students and members of the general public who use online symptom checkers (SCs), meaning "algorithm-based programs that provide potential diagnoses and triage advice," will wind up with inaccurate or misleading… [+4776 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus Australia live news: Regional tourism in NSW to resume on June 1, States with border restrictions won't be opening soon - ABC News
articles.description: The NSW Government confirms it will lift the ban on regional travel within the state from June 1, in news that will come as a relief to struggling regional tourism operators.
articles.content:
The NSW Government has confirmed it will lift the ban on regional travel in the state from June 1.
Tasmania, Western Australian and Queensland authorities say they will not yet ease border restrictions, despite continued low numbers of active coronavirus cas… [+11547 chars]
